Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2007 07:46PM hollynp wrote: Hey I had my first mammo about 5 months ago. Had to return the following week for an ultrasound. One large mass in my left breast showed up on mammo. On the ultra two smaller masses showed up in the right breast. I was scheduled for surgery the following week to remove the large mass and biopsy it. Thankfully it was a benign fiberadenoma. Needless to say I was worried sick and the surgery was on my dang 29th bday! My first surgery for anything. Now Ihave to have an ultrasound done on the right breast to see what the smaller masses are. I will make appt Monday and update everyone. Keep your chin up things will prolly turn out just fine.
Posts.Title: Just biopsied....freaking out missz hollynp

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2007 05:25PM hollynp wrote: I was really scared before I had my surgery because the reports from the u/s and mammo said that my mass 5cm and they are usually b9 but when one reachs that size that its more than likely malignant, so needless to say I was freaking out bc i was so worried...thankfully it was b9 even though it grew to like 10cm. I actually never really noticed my lump before and neither had my gf so I dunno how long it was there or if it just blew up over night. hopfully i wont have anymore.
Posts.Title: info about a fibroadenoma chanshan hollynp

Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2007 03:24PM hollynp wrote: Well it was my first surgery ever so I was pretty scared. They had me hooked up to a lot of different IVs in prep for surgery. The staff was very nice to me and explained what was going on. They wheeled me into the operating room and gave me some meds to relax me. The anthesialogist told me that he was about to administer the meds to knock me out and said it would feel a little cold...and told me to count to 10...I got to 9 and was out cold. Everything went very well and before I knew it, they were waking me up and asking hwo I was feeling and bc it was also my birthday the nurses had gotten me a piece of pie from the cafeteria with a candle on it and all the staff sang happy birhday to me...I thought that was really nice. I think the surgery only lasted an hour. I was able to go home the same day. My breasts were wrapped with an ace banage that I had to wear for 2 days. I had a sterile dressing on my incision. I was able to wear sports bras which was recommended bc my breast did not move a lot in the sports bra. I just took it easy for about a week then returned to work. I had moderate pain but they gave me meds for it. My scar is visible which sucks and I can tell where they took out healthy tissue to get all of the tumor but it had to be done. But it was not a horriable experience like I thought it would be...just a little scary. I have two more in the other breast that might have to be removed but at least I know what to excpet so its not so bad. But once you get in there for the surgery and the nurses are talking to you...you get more relaxed and less scared. So keep your chin up..everything will be okay.
Posts.Title: Just biopsied....freaking out missz hollynp

Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2007 12:56PM hollynp wrote: I am 29 and 5 months ago had surgery to remove a 10cm tumor from my left breast. In a week it grew from 5cm to 10cm and the doc said it was the size of a baseball. After it was biopsied it was determined to be a very large Fiberadenoma. I also have two smaller masses of unknown orgin in my right breast so I am a little worried. I am going to schedule an ultrasound on monday bc my dr wanted to have them ultrasounded again within 6 months. The smaller ones did not show up on the mammo but they did on the ultrasound. You are in my prayers that is for sure. Keep your chin up and talk to God..He listens.
